## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
summary(cars)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.

DPLYR
```{r}
install.packages("tidyverse")
library(tidyverse)
```

Clean your data and reshape it
```{r}
mpg

filter_test <- mpg %>% filter(model == 'a4', displ=='1.8')
print(filter_test)


arrange_test <- mpg %>% arrange(displ,cty)
print(arrange_test)


mutate_test <- mpg %>% mutate(old = year <2000)
print(mutate_test)

select_test <- mutate_test %>% select(-drv)
print(select_test)

count_test <- mpg %>% count(model,sort = T)
print(count_test)
```

Graphs
```{r}
ggplot(data=mpg)+
  geom_point(mapping = aes (x= displ, y=hwy))
```
```{r}
ggplot(data=mpg)+
  geom_point(mapping=aes(x=displ,y=hwy,color=class))
```
```{r}
ggplot(data=mpg)+
  geom_point(mapping=aes(x=displ,y=hwy))+
  facet_wrap (~class, nrow=2)
```


```{r}
ggplot(data=mpg)+
  geom_point(mapping=aes(x=displ,y=hwy))+
  facet_grid(drv ~cyl)
```


```{r}
ggplot(data=mpg)+
  geom_point(mapping=aes(x=displ,y=hwy))+
  geom_smooth(mapping=aes (x=displ,y=hwy))
```


```{r}
ggplot(data=mpg, mapping=aes (x=displ,y=hwy))+
  geom_point(mapping=aes(color=class))+
  geom_smooth()
```


```{r}
diamonds
ggplot(data=diamonds)+
  geom_bar(mapping=aes(x=cut))
```
